content: On August 13, 1991, the Atlanta Braves faced off against the Houston Astros in a thrilling game that showcased the brilliance of pitcher Tom Glavine. Glavine threw a complete game shutout, leading the Braves to a 5-0 victory. This performance was a key moment in the Braves' remarkable season, which would culminate in their first pennant in Atlanta and set the stage for a decade of success in the 1990s.
